title: Royal Ride: Kate Middleton, Prince William Spotted In Auto-Rickshaw During Their Pakistan Visit
text:
The Duke and Duchess of Cambridge started their journey in Pakistan on a rather exciting note. Kate Middleton and Prince William arrived for the reception hosted by British Commission in Pakistan, in a specially decorated auto-rickshaw. The royal couple are on a five-day tour of the country.

Kate Middleton wore a glittering emerald green gown with silver earrings, while Prince William complemented her by wearing a bandh-gala knee length green sherwani with matching trousers.

AFP

Here's what Prince William spoke at the event:

"We (Pakistan & UK) share unique bonds and so it will always be in our best interests for Pakistan to succeed."

"You can always rely on the UK to keep playing an important role as a key partner and friend."

On the first day, the royal couple along with Pakistan's Prime Minister Imran Khan, visited a school in Islamabad, to highlight the importance of education for young children. When the couple was visiting the school, a school girl came to Prince William and told him that she was a big fan of Princess Diana. To which he replied, “I was a big fan of my mother too,” as reported by The Sun.

They also visited Nur Khan airbase, where they were received by Pakistani Foreign Minister Shah Mehmood Qureshi and his wife, reported The Dawn.

This is their first royal tour to Pakistan after 2006, when the Prince of Wales and the Duchess of Cornwall, Prince Charles, and Camilla, travelled to Pakistan.

Kate Middleton and Prince William travelled to an event on a decorated rickshaw for the reception hosted by British Commission in Pakistan. The royal couple are on a five-day tour of the country.
